utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have delicately placed one graham cracker, exactly six marshmallows atop a perfectly melted chocolate bar.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: In an omelet, darling, really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not an omelet. A smorelet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Care for one?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, thank you!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about you, sweetheart? Are you ready for your taste buds to be launched into breakfast nirvana?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sure, thanks. Oh, is it okay if my friend Ashley comes over tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course. Now, eat.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad! Are there marshmallows in this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And chocolate?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. That’s the point, it’s a smorelet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh… I gotta go. Love you. Love you!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bye, honey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. This is almost as good as my chocolate mousse chimichanga. Ah ha, I knew you’d reconsider. It’s like David Hasselhoff. At first you’re repulsed but strangely you’re drawn in.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, still repulsed. Bye!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder what’s up with Alexis. She seems a little out of it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Isn’t it obvious?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, she’s in love.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, come on darling, in case you haven’t noticed, she’s not a little girl anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, Mother, I think if Alexis were in love she would have told me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah ah ah ah … the fact that she hasn’t told you is how we know it’s real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother …

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay, and the fact that she … mentioned it to me last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is he? Where did she meet him?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I don’t know. She wouldn’t say. No, diva’s honor. She didn’t tell me anything. She didn’t even tell me his name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe she told you and not me. I’m supposed to be her go-to guy.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, darling, of course you are. It’s just, you know, it’s first love. It’s magical, ethereal … it defies logic.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh, Richard … your phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmuh.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, Beckett. Maybe it’s a nice murder, darling. Brighten your day.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Good boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When Alexis took her first steps, I was there to catch her when she fell. The first time she rode her bike without training wheels I was the maniac chasing her down the street screaming for her to watch out for the old lady with the walker. Even her first word –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. Daddy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it was "denouement". I stressed story structure from an early age. Anyway, I’m afraid this is the beginning of the end of our special thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I wouldn’t worry, Castle. I mean, I’ve seen the way that she looks at you. Your real problem is that girls who adore their daddies usually end up marrying guys just like them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Parish! Good morning. Got an i.d.?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not yet. How come you guys never bring me coffee? I’m here before you, doing all the work –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can have the rest of mine.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Actually, I don’t drink coffee. But would it kill you to bring me a bearclaw?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of killing …

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Single GSW to the chest, large caliber, probably a .45. Lividity suggests time of death around midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! I have those boxers. Thomas Nash. Very pricey British brand. Amazingly soft, as silk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just saying … he was probably very comfortable when he was … shot and killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was this guy doing out here practically naked at midnight.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t bother with any of your perverted theories, Castle. I found fibers in the bullet hole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he was wearing clothes when he was shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. The killer shot him and then hung around to take his bloody clothes off him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe the killer was worried that there was forensic evidence on the clothes that would connect them.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, uni found this wallet out in a garbage can near 5th.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Photo on the license matches Captain Underpants here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, my nephew loves those books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Daniel Goldstein, 25, lives in SoHo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s also got a work id from Burman Rose, down on Wall Street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he lived downtown and worked downtown; what was he doing way up here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s take this down to the lab.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I wear boxers. What do you wear? Thong? Cheekies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I told you mine. Bloomers? Granny panties? Commando?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: His clothes were taken? Why would anyone take his clothes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know, Ms. Goldstein. Can you tell us what your brother might have been doing in the park?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That late? I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the place where Daniel was found is known for drug activity. Was he using?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No. He barely even drank.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any enemies? Or conflicts that you know of?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No. No, look, none of this makes any sense. It’s just … it’s not like him. Our parents both died in a car accident when he was twelve and since then, he’s always been so cautious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about dating? Was there anyone special in his life?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, you wish, but no. He barely had a social life. Or social skills. I mean, he was such a sweetheart, but a dork, you know? And he was always at work anyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At Burman Rose? What did he do for them?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Created financial products. He was this incredible math genius. He got his PhD from MIT, I thought for sure that he’d be a professor or something, but these hedge funds, they hire guys like him and they pay them obscene amounts of money. Twenty five years old, he bought my apartment for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lab got a fingerprint off our vic’s wallet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyone good?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Awaiting court dates on three aggravated assault cases in the past month, Mr. D’Andre. You’ve inflicted dozens of broken bones, gouged out one of your victim’s eyes, bit off part of an ear of another one; sounds like murder was inevitable. I’m just curious, why did you take his clothes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then why were your fingerprints on a dead man’s wallet? Did he just happen to drop it and you politely picked it up for him? And why did my detectives find this unregistered .45 in your apartment, which just happens to match the size of the bullet hole in my victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you’re so innocent, Mr. D’Andre, why did you resist arrest and try to put one of my detectives through a wall?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, the right turtleneck and no one is even going to notice, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe a scarf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you just confess to the truth, it’s gonna come out sooner or later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With a wallet lying conveniently next to him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, if you’re not going to admit to it, you might want to try at least coming up with a story that’s a little more convincing –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like you weren’t scared.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I want this guy to fry, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, he will. As soon as Lanie confirms that that bullet is a .45.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not a .45.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m positive.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope. It’s not a .44 or a .357 or .22 or a 9mm or any other kind of bullet I’ve ever seen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s a new kind of bullet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh no. Not new at all. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s round.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: See that white coating?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, what is it? Oxidation?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Lead oxide, to be exact.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rust?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep. Based on the amount of it I’d say that bullet is 200 years old.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 200 year old bullet can only mean one thing. Time travelling killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ergo, the killer could have entered present time through a time ripple, killed Goldstein, and gone back through the time ripple. Which means we just need to find the time ripple –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you please stop saying ‘time ripple’?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It sounds kind of dirty, doesn’t it? If the ripple closed … time machine! We need a time machine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, in this century we still haven’t ruled out our big buddy Mr. D’Andre.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he just doesn’t seem like the time travel type to me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can’t be a time travelling killer. Bullet had 200 years of rust on it. If the killer was a time traveler the bullet would have been brand new.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless time travel causes rust.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On your brain. Have you followed up with the victim’s sister regarding the antique bullet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep, she has no clue about antique bullets or guns. But there’s somebody who does. Abe Sandrich, the antiques weapon expert you requested.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That reminds me. I’m starving.

utterance.speaker: ABE
utterance.content: I like .45s. Catch the right angle and this sucker could take your head clean off. But it’s not the gun you’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: ABE
utterance.content: Barrel would have had to be modified. This one’s factory fresh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, do you think D’Andre the giant was telling the truth when he said he found the wallet in the grass?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the killer did take Goldstein’s clothes, so it’s possible the wallet might have fallen out when he left the crime scene. What kind of a pistol would have fired that bullet?

utterance.speaker: ABE
utterance.content: We usually just call them lead balls, for obvious reasons. I’d say a whole lot of eighteenth century flintlocks, too many brands to even speculate. You’ll need to find the actual pistol to match it to this lead ball.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how many people would own that kind of antique pistol?

utterance.speaker: ABE
utterance.content: Hard to say. They’re considered collectibles, so they don’t have to be registered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Making it pretty smart to kill someone with one.

utterance.speaker: ABE
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Guns may be old, but they got plenty of killing left in them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So is, uh, D’Andre our guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m afraid not.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Why did he go all Hulk Hogan on me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, why did the scorpion sting the frog? It’s his nature.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ROY MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yeah well, D’Andre will be seeing nature from behind bars from now on for assaulting an officer. I’ll see he gets the max, Detective.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you, Captain.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You know you can take a couple days, if you like. Catch some movies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Read Naked Heat!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. No need, sir.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Still no luck with the clothes. Unis looked in every trash can within a five block radius of the park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is so special about these clothes that our killer would take them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe our killer came through the time ripple naked and needed the clothes. Like in The Terminator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sadly, I don’t have a better theory at this point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, question is, what did a Wall Street number cruncher like Goldstein get himself into? Castle and I’ll go to his firm, you guys see if you can track down any antique gun enthusiasts on social media sites or local clubs. Maybe someone from Goldstein’s life will pop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I just don’t get how someone could shoot Goldstein, steal his clothes, and then not hang onto his wallet. Just doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe giant moths killed him and then ate his clothes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Castle. If this case is boring for you don’t have to stay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no. I’m just checking my e-mails, my texts to see if Alexis called. I can’t believe she told my mother she’s in love and is holding out on me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to call her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no! You have to let her tell you in her own time when she’s ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m the cool dad. Why can’t she be ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No wait, listen to me. My dad tried to do the same thing when I was her age, and I ended up dating a grunge rocker who smelled like wet flannel and clove cigarettes for seven months. You do not mess with a teenage girl and her hormones.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. I won’t call her. Did you say something about a giant moth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: ADAM MURPHY
utterance.content: In his underwear? Danny’s been working for me for two years, but I just don’t know what he’d be up to in the park. He wasn’t exactly the outdoors type.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about antique guns, Mr. Murphy? Do you know anything about them?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Antiques? No, no he wasn’t into guns at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I understand he worked long hours. Do you know when he left last night?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Uh yeah, right around 9:30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh hey, let me help you with that.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: This is Julia Foster, Daniel’s assistant. This is Detective Beckett, Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were you here last night when Goldstein left?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea where he was heading?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: No, he just said goodnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about during the day? Was there anything out of the ordinary? Any strange phone calls?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: No, just the usual unhappy investor. Although …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Although what?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: It’s the Lower Tide Fund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: It was one of the financial products Daniel created for us. A synthetic CDO cubed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: English?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: A really big bet that prices would return to historical norms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what happened?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: It tanked. Hundreds of millions of dollars were lost overnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was this?

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: Three months ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There must have been a lot of angry investors.

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: I fielded scores of less than complimentary messages from angry clients.

utterance.speaker: JULIA
utterance.content: More like apoplectic. And a lot of them blamed Danny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, well, I’ll need a copy of all of these messages and a list of anyone who lost their money in the fund.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Any luck connecting antique gun owners to investors in Goldstein’s failed fund, detectives?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah. So far I’ve seen a lot of cool old guns on these social media sites for antique gun lovers, but none of the owners pop in Goldstein’s life.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Erwin ‘Quick Draw’ Finkelstein. Proud owner of a Remington Outlaw made in 1875. Now that’s a great looking gun. Check it out, Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s nice. See, back then they were into the artistry of it all.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. They’re like little sculptures … that can kill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, this list of Lower Tide Fund investors? They all lost more than a million bucks a piece.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: A million dollars? If I had that kind of scratch I’d put it in something safe. Like my mattress.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh, check it out. Ivan ‘Yosemite Sam’ Podofski.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Ivan Podofski?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, what do you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Looks like we have a winner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. He does kind of look like Yosemite Sam.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: On a bad hair day.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah well, in addition to having an antique gun collection, Mr. Podofski here lost more than four million bucks in our vic’s Lower Tide Fund.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He also left this message for Goldstein the day the fund flatlined.

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: They had a way of handling folks like you in the old country, Goldstein. It’s called a firing squad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think he offered him a blindfold and a cigarette?

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: I think some context is in order. I had only just lost four million dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and in that context you threatened to kill Mr. Goldstein and then he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between eleven and one?

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: Asleep, in my bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And can anyone vouch for that?

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: Me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Myself and I got your back, too?

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: Okay, look. I know how this appears. But I think there’s an explanation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fire away.

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: Several months ago I had a consultation at Burman Rose. When I mentioned my guns, Goldstein asked if I knew how he could get a hold of a Sherlock Holmes gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … you’re pointing the finger at Sir Arthur Conan Doyle?

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: I’m saying that Goldstein clearly had an interest in antique guns. Maybe that interest got him killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you’re so confident that Goldstein got mixed up with someone else, I’m sure you won’t mind submitting your collection for testing to ballistics.

utterance.speaker: PODOFSKI
utterance.content: These are antiques, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you prefer being arrested for murder?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ballistics is taking possession of Podofski’s guns. They should have preliminaries by tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They never prefer to be arrested for murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm. All right, keep at it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Just got a hit from Goldstein’s car from traffic enforcement. Parking ticket from last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This has got to be a joke.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’re you walking about, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Goldstein drives a DeLorean. The car used as a time machine in Back to the Future? There’s no way that’s a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The ticket was written at two in the morning. That’s post mortem.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The car should still be there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, East 82nd between Lex and Third. That’s a few blocks from the park.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but if you’re going to park illegally, why not park closer?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because – he was going somewhere on that block. Three more parking tickets in the last several months, all on 82nd between Lex and Third.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was going somewhere regularly on that block.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe a girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless you think that’s where that time ripple is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look into it. Pick that car up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You gotta be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ha! Well, it’s definitely Goldstein’s car. Or a time machine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. If I’m not mistaken that’s a flux capacitor in there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And that is the reactor core. Maybe Castle was right, Goldstein came back to the future and he got whacked.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why’d he keep coming here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe there’s something in the car that’ll help.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hope so. Lot of doors to knock on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Patty. I got a vic’s car that needs towing. It’s a 238 East 82nd. It’s an ’81 to ’82 DeLorean, New York plates, J L D -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me call you back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse us, sir. I’m Detective Ryan, this is Detective Esposito. Mind if we ask you a few questions?

utterance.speaker: LORD HENRY
utterance.content: Ah. Top of the morning to you, Constables. Lord Henry, at your service.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, thanks. Mind telling us where you got those clothes?

utterance.speaker: LORD HENRY
utterance.content: Oh, not at all, dear boy. I picked them up at the haberdashery across the park. Well gentlemen, if that is all, I shall bid you good day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just a second, pal. You know, we think those clothes might have been involved in -

utterance.speaker: LORD HENRY
utterance.content: I said, good day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sir, we need you to come –

utterance.speaker: LORD HENRY
utterance.content: Good day!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay, bro?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: LORD HENRY
utterance.content: Unhand me, you rogue!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, thank you Ryan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’s Esposito?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At home, resting. So our Lord Henry’s story checks out. Ryan found a matching ascot in a garbage can where Henry said he found the clothes. Our guy might be unstable, but he is not our killer. So why was Goldstein wearing this costume?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s Victorian. Antique. Kind of fits with the whole time traveler theory, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t know what to think, but the plot thickens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Forensics came back on the clothes?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Between the garbage can and our homeless guy there was a quite a list of gross-out substances, of which I will spare you the details. . But I did find something interesting on the right hand glove and the right sleeve of the shirt. Potassium nitrate and sulfur.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gunshot residue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Goldstein did not go quietly into the night, he had a gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he fired back.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: I got something here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Another antique.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s exactly like the one that killed Goldstein.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, it does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s say that our killer , say our killer is standing over here. Goldstein was killed all the way over there. A nice, flat area between them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you getting at, Castle? Some kind of game?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a game. Goldstein was wearing formal, turn of the century clothes. He shot an antique bullet, identical to the one the was killed with. Probably fired from an identical gun. four, five, six, seven, Lanie said he was killed at about midnight? Saint James Church is right over there – thanks – on Madison. I bet they could hear the bells chiming all the way from over here. … thirty nine, forty … They stood at about forty paces from one another. It wasn’t a game. It was an old fashioned duel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who dares besmirch –

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Oh, God. Don’t shoot.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s okay Ashley, he’s not going to shoot you. What the heck, dad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I might be asking you the same – Ashley? This is Ashley?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ash, this is my dad, Rick. And I have no idea why he’s waving a gun.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: So nice to meet you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You too, Ashley. And I have a perfectly good reason why I’m waving a gun.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Excuse us.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Explain yourself!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got this gun for research for a case. Which you might know if you had checked in with me today.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s just say that one of us has nothing to hide. Perhaps you’d like to explain yourself?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What, that I was kissing a boy? Is that a problem?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You tell me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, the only reason I invited Ashley over tonight was so that you could meet him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes well, me meeting Ashley has smeared the lip gloss all over your face.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: I… I … I … really should be going.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You can stay, Ashley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, the gun? My bad. Please, Ashley, stay. You can check out the gun.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Call me later?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, if it’s okay with your gun. – Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s okay with me.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Thank you. And I just want you to know how much I respect Alexis. I mean, you don’t have to worry about issues of respect. She’s probably the most respectable person I know and I respect you, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s good to know that. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like him. He’s respectful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got it, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So Ivan Podofski’s antique gun collection all cleared ballistics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, at least some guy in ballistics had fun firing them off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I also checked with Goldstein’s sister and coworkers. None of them know anything about duels and Victorian clothes or what Goldstein was doing on East 82nd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like he had a secret life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That somehow led to a duel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he figured someone besmirched his honor. Maybe it was about a girl. Matter of fact Alexis, her new boyfriend – who has a girl’s name, by the way – he thought I was going to shoot him last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. How’s Esposito?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s sleeping in. Mostly because he can’t move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you figure out what Goldstein was doing on East 83nd?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but get this. I’m going through Goldstein’s car and I found a pile of receipts he must have been planning to submit for reimbursement, one of them from three weeks ago at a café. On it he wrote ‘coffee with Troy Kenworth’ and that name kind of rings a bell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One of the angry Lower Tide Fund investors?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but his father Charles Kenworth was. Guy loses two million bucks and then he loses his house, his marriage, and then two months ago he killed himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Troy have any priors?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: More like afters. After his father committed suicide he was charged with assault in four separate bar fights.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Revenge! Oldest motive for murder in the book. Maybe Troy thought someone besmirched his father’s honor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he forced Goldstein to settle the score.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah, I was the one who found his body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The report says that he used a shot gun.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hey. Why aren’t you in there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett’s doing a mothering thing. Wanted to limit the testosterone in the room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can’t imagine walking in on that.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah. Pretty messy. I try not to think about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But since then, Mr. Kenworth, you have charges pending in four assault cases.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: I started drinking too much, lashed out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But those were just random people at bars. I mean, they weren’t even responsible for your father’s suicide. But Goldstein… he put your father in the fund that lost him all of his money. I could understand blaming him.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: I did. But then I talked to him and he said he warned Pop to diversify. And the fact is, Dad and Mom had been having problems for years. When we lost the house and I had to drop out of school it was the last straw and Mom left him. That’s what pushed him over the edge. And ever since his death, Mom’s been struggling to make payments on our apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you went to go and see Goldstein three weeks ago?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Look, I wanted to figure out if any money was left in the account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did Goldstein tell you?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: The truth. All the money’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that must have made you pretty angry.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Okay, I know what you’re getting at, but that meeting is what turned me around. I haven’t had a drink since. Mom and I have been able to stay in our place. I might even go back to school next semester. All because Danny’s a stand-up guy and he gave me a job. That’s where I was the night he got killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At Burman Rose?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Uh, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a job did Danny give you?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: I can’t say. Look, I had to sign a confidentiality agreement, okay? I could be fired.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or you could be arrested. Is this job on 82nd between Lex and Third?

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: What was the exact number of pounds that Mr. Fogg bet that he could travel around the world in 80 days?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twenty thousand.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Correct, sir. Name the volcano that led to the center of the Earth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! I want to say –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Open the damn door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we?

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Victorian London.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When are we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Gas Lamp League. It’s a steampunk society. Straight ahead is our club president, Owen Peterson. He’s on the pennyfarthing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s the time machine from Time and Away. I love that movie.

utterance.speaker: STEAMPUNK MEMBER
utterance.content: Owen! Give us a poem!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Steampunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a subculture that embraces the simplicity and romance of the past, at the same time couples it with the hope and promise and sheer super coolness of futuristic design.

utterance.speaker: OWEN PETERSON
utterance.content: … you’re a clone, you say? There are more of you? Well, the more the merrier! To you alls I’ll be true. Baaaah!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, Mr. Peterson. I’m Detective –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I try that?

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: I don’t know what to tell you, Detective. We all heard about Danny yesterday. It’s hard to believe. We saw him here the night before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the way you and your friends were yukking it up makes me feel like you weren’t so upset.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: We’re just romantics, Detective. Look at the world, don’t like what we see, so we recreate it here. An oasis where potential and ingenuity is limitless. Where there’s poetry and wonder and meaning, even in death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time did he leave that night?

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: Around eleven thirty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he tell you what he was doing?

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He went to the park. For a duel.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: What do you mean, a duel?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The kind where people shoot at each other. They were using antique guns. Do you know anything about that?

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: Dueling pistols.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With uh, lead balls with white coating?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This has been fired recently.

utterance.speaker: OWEN
utterance.content: They’re just for show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Adam. Stop! Stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Out of the way! Get out of the way!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s going for the time machine!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s just a bunch of interviews. I don’t know why you didn’t take the whole day off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop him!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Esposito. How’s your neck?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Yeah, I shot him. He just kind of crumpled over backwards, but I thought he was kidding. I jogged over, expecting him to jump up any second. He was just lying there, so still, and then I saw the blood and I hear Julia, she’s on her knees screaming ‘no, please, God no’… I freaked out. I took his clothes and I just ran.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Julia? You mean Goldstein’s assistant?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: He was in love with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Had they been seeing each other a long time?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: No. No, Dan just kissed her once. A couple of weeks ago, out at a bar. She wasn’t interested in him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you were involved with her?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Not really … involved, but Dan caught us fooling around in my office late one night last week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you couldn’t think of a better way of settling this other than a duel?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: Oh, we … we … we just thought it would be funny. Danny swore that we couldn’t get hurt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shooting at each other?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: He ran all these complex equations. He said that at 40 paces there was no chance that we could actually hit each other. Something about 18th century guns having no rifling in the barrel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if you couldn’t kill each other, what was the point of the duel?

utterance.speaker: ADAM
utterance.content: To impress Julia. She would never get serious with geeks like us. But we figured if … if maybe she saw us duel over her, then maybe that one … one of us could ...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Julia confirmed that she was the only other person present at the duel. No one else knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let her go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you point the gun at someone and shoot and not expect to kill them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, they were blinded by the romance of it all. And Goldstein did the math.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, between this and the Lower Tide Fund, maybe he’s not a genius.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe he’s just unlucky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, I’ve got a problem. Because I have to make a recommendation to the DA between murder and manslaughter, the difference being life in prison or just a couple of years. I mean, are antique guns really so inaccurate?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only one way to find out.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: That’s your target, that’s my target. Shoot your target.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Manslaughter it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. There’s my girl. Come here. Come here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. Hang on. There we go. Hey, about last night, um… it was unexpected.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m sorry, too. I should have told you Ashley was a boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ha, well … why spoil the surprise?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So I have a question for you. But it’s a little embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, I love when you’re embarrassed.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh hey, listen. You can … you can ask me whatever you want. And I promise I’ll do my best to make it as un-embarrassing as possible.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How do you know when you’re in love?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know it’s an emotion, a feeling, and you can’t exactly define, like technically, how you know when you’re feeling it, but since I’ve never felt it before how do I know what I’m feeling is even it at all? Except of course for the fact that I’m feeling all these things I’ve never felt before like in my stomach, in my throat, and even kind of in my ears … I mean, which just has to mean that it’s love, right? Considering I only feel them when I’m with Ashley or thinking about him … I mean, it’s gotta be love, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because I’m feeling all these things I’ve read about in poems and heard about in songs but never completely understood but now I do. I understand and I’m listening to all this music and reading all this poetry in a completely new and glorious light which I just think has to mean it’s love. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And I can’t stop thinking about him, Daddy. I don’t even want to, because he’s the greatest, sweetest, most adorable guy and his nose crinkles when he laughs and … I’m just so happy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks, Dad. I love you. I feel so much better now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Glad we had that talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett. How do you know when you’re in love?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All the songs make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Adam Murphy didn’t kill Goldstein.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he confessed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I believe that he believes he did it. But he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It bothered me that we couldn’t hit the target at the shooting range. And so I ran ballistics on the dueling pistols. The bullet that hit Daniel Goldstein didn't match either one of them. Adam couldn’t have killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re talking full on grassy knoll conspiracy theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not theory. Fact. There was a third shooter and that’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you find Adam Murphy’s bullet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lead ball.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. He didn’t kill Goldstein, but he did kill squirrel-stein.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are the odds, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh no… they took his clothes, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could you? Yeah I know. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so we know Goldstein was standing right over here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Facing Adam, who was right over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. And if our killer wanted to shoot him without either of them seeing, he would be standing right over … there, by that clump of trees.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: Detective? I’ve got clothing fibers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This thread look familiar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’d recognize that burgundy velvet anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kind of says steampunk, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Matter of fact, I think I know the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Volcano in Journey to the Center of the Earth. Snæfells.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Couldn’t stay away. Can I get you guys something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure, Troy. We’re looking for a shooter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I think we already found one. Nice uniform, by the way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found your father’s shotgun. We know you modified it in order to shoot antique lead ball bullets.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: What are you talking about? Adam Murphy already confessed, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out, Adam Murphy couldn’t have done it. It’s a science-y ballistics thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was pretty clever, firing your father’s shotgun at the exact moment that Adam and Goldstein fired their guns.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Making Adam believe that he was the one that killed Goldstein, right as the church bells chimed midnight. Isn’t that right?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Seeing him in here every night, in that ridiculous outfit, just throwing around all that money … why should he get to live like that when my dad is dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knowing that our shooter was a staff member at the club led us straight back to Troy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He overheard Goldstein and Murphy planning the duel and took his opportunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then Troy’s alibi fell apart as soon as we started interviewing other staff members who couldn’t remember seeing him there half an hour before or after the duel.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Dueling over a girl, avenging the death of a loved one …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cuts to the heart of romance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the tragedy.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Speaking of tragedy, did you hear about Detective Esposito?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, what about him?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Oh, he …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, God … dude. What happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, I’m okay –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, I really am fine, bro. We got this stuff from storage.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You should have seen your faces!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain, you really sold it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Speaking of tragedy, did you hear about Detective Esposito?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not really that fine.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah, let me just …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dude, neck brace.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lock it down, lock it down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

utterance.speaker: JOSH DAVIDSON
utterance.content: Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Josh, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: I got your text.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean the text where I said I was going to pick you up?

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Yeah, I was nearby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well uh, Josh, this is Captain Montgomery, Richard Castle, Detectives Esposito and Ryan.

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Hey, boys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN_ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Boys?

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Catch any bad guys today?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Every day.

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Right. You all set?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, let me just get my stuff.

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … you and Beckett?

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Mmm… what about us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You tell me.

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: You’re the writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. And you are …

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Ah, Kate hasn’t told you about me, has she?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s to tell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Yeah. See you around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘Bye guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes. Thanks for that talk last night. I feel so much better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, you can, uh … you can always talk to me. Or, at me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. Being in love is exhausting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you got that right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You okay, Dad? You seem distracted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about? You have my undivided attention.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Good. Because I want to go on a date tonight. How’s that sound?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Great. Have a good time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I meant with you, Dad. You’ll always be my go-to guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Gram put you up to this?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I have no idea what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pity date. I’ll take it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a terrible liar.
